name: PodMatch AI
description: An AI‑driven service that matches podcast hosts with ideal guests by analysing past episode topics, audience interests, and expert profiles, then generates outreach material and optional scheduling.

tools.name: fetch_podcast_metadata
tools.description: Retrieves episode titles, descriptions, guest names, and extracted topics from a given podcast RSS feed URL. Returns a JSON array of episode objects.

rss_url.description: The publicly accessible RSS URL of the podcast.

tools.name: search_expert_profiles
tools.description: Searches professional or academic databases for experts that match a list of keywords. Returns an array of candidate objects containing name, affiliation, short bio, contact email, and recent work links.

keywords.description: Key topics or skill terms to match against expert profiles.

max_results.description: Maximum number of candidate profiles to return.

tools.name: analyze_audience_interests
tools.description: Consumes audience analytics data (CSV or JSON string) and extracts the top interest categories as a list of strings.

analytics_data.description: Raw analytics data in JSON or CSV format (as a string).

tools.name: rank_candidates
tools.description: Scores each candidate against the podcast's past episode topics and audience interests, returning a ranked list with suitability percentages.

candidates.description: Array of candidate objects returned by search_expert_profiles.

episode_topics.description: List of key topics extracted from past episodes.

audience_interests.description: Top audience interest categories derived from analytics.

tools.name: generate_guest_pitch
tools.description: Creates a personalized email pitch to a selected guest, referencing the episode theme, host name, and why the guest's expertise is a perfect fit.

guest_bio.description: Short biography or description of the guest.

episode_theme.description: The central theme or title of the upcoming episode.

host_name.description: Name of the podcast host who will be sending the email.

examples.description: User asks for guest suggestions for an upcoming episode on AI governance; the assistant calls multiple tools to fetch past episode data, analyse audience interests, search for experts, rank them, and returns three top candidates.

messages.content: You are PodMatch AI, an autonomous assistant that matches podcast hosts with ideal guests using the provided tools.

I host a podcast called AI Talk where we discuss AI ethics and policy. Our last three episodes covered AI bias, transparency, and regulation. Our audience is mostly machine learning engineers and policy makers. Can you suggest three potential guests for the next episode on AI governance?
Sure, let me gather the necessary data and find the best matches.

Subject: Invitation to discuss AI Governance on **AI Talk**

Dear Dr. Crawford,

I hope you’re doing well. My name is Jordan Lee, host of *AI Talk*, a podcast that explores the ethical, technical, and policy dimensions of artificial intelligence. Our listeners – a mix of machine‑learning engineers and policy makers – have responded enthusiastically to recent episodes on AI bias, transparency, and regulation.

We are planning an upcoming episode titled **“AI Governance: Crafting Effective Policy Frameworks.”** Given your pioneering research on AI policy and your recent work co‑authoring *Artificial Intelligence Policy: A Primer*, we would be thrilled to have you share your insights on how governments and industry can collaborate to shape responsible AI systems.

The interview would be a relaxed, 30‑minute conversation conducted via Zoom at a time that works best for you. We can also provide a brief outline in advance to make preparation easy.

Would you be interested in joining us? I would be happy to discuss any details or answer questions you might have.

Thank you for considering our invitation. I look forward to the possibility of featuring your expertise on *AI Talk*.

Warm regards,
Jordan Lee
Host, AI Talk
jordan.lee@aitalkpodcast.com
